page.title: 20LOCAL WILD PLANTS
page.content: THE WILD PLANTS AROUND US ARE: {MARESTAIL, DAISY, COMMON BINDWEED, {SHEPHERD'S PURSE, LADIES' BEDSTRAW, {BUTTERCUP, SOFT MEADOW_GRASS, YARROW, {DEAD NETTLES, STINGING NETTLES, {DANDELION, COMMON FORGET_ME_NOT AND {DOCK LEAVES.}IN THE RESIDENTIAL AREA CLOSE TO OUR SCHOOL, WILD PLANTS HAVE FOUND UNUSUAL PLACES TO GROW. SUCH AS IN{BETWEEN THE PATH, IN THE GUTTER, IN {AN OLD TIN CAN AND IN AN OLD CAR ON {THE DUMP.}THESE WILD PLANTS ARE ABLE TO ADAPT TO VARIED GROWING PLACES AND SPREAD THEIR SEEDS WIDELY. IN SUMMER 1984 OUR GARDENERS SPAYED WEED KILLER AROUND OUR MOBILE CLASSROOM. AS A RESULT ALL THE PLANTS DIED. IN 1985 THESE WILD PLANTS HAVE GROWN AGAIN: {BUTTERCUP, MAYWEED, SYCAMORE, {HOARY PLANTAIN, SHEPHERD'S PURSE, {MARESTAIL AND THE THISTLE.
